intro: Piper gatunense var. latum, commonly known as the broadleaf pepper vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
